title: Build a Google-like search homepage and results UI

requirements.text: Create a Google-inspired search homepage UI with a centered logo, a prominent search input, and primary/secondary action buttons (e.g., “Search” and “I’m Feeling Lucky”), using only original branding (no Google trademarks, fonts, or logos).
acceptanceCriteria: The landing page renders a centered logo, search input, and two action buttons.
All branding is original (no use of the Google wordmark, multicolor logo, or proprietary fonts).
Layout is responsive for mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement a search results page that displays a list of results for the entered query, including a result title, a URL/host line, and a short snippet per result; results may be generated from a local mock dataset and filtered client-side.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting a query navigates to a results view and shows a results list.
Each result shows a title, a URL/host line, and a snippet.
If no results match, an empty-state message is shown in English.

requirements.text: Add basic search UX behaviors: pressing Enter triggers search, the search box supports clearing/editing, and the query is reflected in the URL so results can be refreshed/bookmarked.
acceptanceCriteria: Pressing Enter in the input triggers navigation to results.
The query appears in the URL (e.g., as a query string) and is restored on reload.
Users can edit the query on the results page and re-run the search.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, button styles) with a clean minimalist aesthetic that evokes a modern search engine while remaining clearly non-identical to Google’s visual design (avoid the exact Google color palette and styling).
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent typography and component styling.
The theme is minimalist and search-centric but not an exact replica of Google’s design.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Add the generated static images to the frontend as assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (logo on the homepage and optionally a small logo in the results header).
acceptanceCriteria: The homepage displays the generated logo image.
No image is served via the backend; images are loaded as static frontend assets.

constraints: Do not use Google trademarks, the Google wordmark, or the official multicolor Google logo.
Do not integrate external search APIs (e.g., Google Search API) unless the user later provides an explicit endpoint and requirements.
All user-facing text must be in English.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose them as-is.
nonGoals: Implementing real web crawling or indexing

required: Minimalist abstract search logo mark with clean geometric shapes, neutral palette (search-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide horizontal version of the same logo/wordmark style with original text (not 'Google'), clean typography (search-logo-wide.dim_1200x300.png)
